channel.title: Character Appearance on first login?
channel.description:
How would I bring up the Character Customization screen on login?
This means when first logging in giving you the option to change your appearance.
I'm using PI.

item.title: Character Appearance on first login?
item.dc:creator: @Christmas_tree Christmas_tree
item.description:
@Christmas_tree wrote:

[quote=“M0R3TANK1NG, post:31, topic:477318”]Ok.

In English, how would I fix it?[/quote]

Email me your client class and your interface clicking class

livealittlespendalot@googlemail.com

item.title: Character Appearance on first login?
item.dc:creator: @Christmas_tree Christmas_tree
item.description:
@Christmas_tree wrote:

[quote=“M0R3TANK1NG, post:29, topic:477318”][quote author=Christmas_tree link=topic=595511.msg4193260#msg4193260 date=1357138295]
That’s because you har undeclared variables. You’ll have to reference them from the client class
[/quote]

I don’t know what that means, I’m slightly new to this.[/quote]

A variable is an identifier used to refer to a particular memory location used to store data within the program. This data can be changed or modified while the program is running.

Examples of variables are integers, doubles, longs etc etc

You are attempting to set the value of a variable without declaring it first. It’s like trying to get to Japan by airplane without purchasing a ticket first.

Read full topic

item.title: Character Appearance on first login?
item.dc:creator: @Christmas_tree Christmas_tree
item.description:
@Christmas_tree wrote:

This has been in servers for years. All you need to do is copy the code…

      case 101: // Character Design Screen

            int gender = inStream.readSignedByte();

            int head = inStream.readSignedByte();

            int jaw = inStream.readSignedByte();

            int torso = inStream.readSignedByte();

            int arms = inStream.readSignedByte();

            int hands = inStream.readSignedByte();

            int legs = inStream.readSignedByte();

            int feet = inStream.readSignedByte();

            int hairC = inStream.readSignedByte();

            int torsoC = inStream.readSignedByte();

            int legsC = inStream.readSignedByte();

            int feetC = inStream.readSignedByte();

            int skinC = inStream.readSignedByte();



            playerLook[0] = gender;

            pHead = head;

            pBeard = jaw;

            pTorso = torso;

            pArms = arms;

            pHands = hands;

            pLegs = legs;

            pFeet = feet;

            playerLook[1] = hairC;

            playerLook[2] = torsoC;

            playerLook[3] = legsC;

            playerLook[4] = feetC;

            playerLook[5] = skinC;

            apset = true;

            appearanceUpdateRequired = true;

            break;

Read full topic

item.title: Character Appearance on first login?
item.dc:creator: @M0R3TANK1NG M0R3TANK1NG
item.description:
@M0R3TANK1NG wrote:

[quote=“runescape sucks, post:13, topic:477318”]instead of c.showInterface(3559);
put
c.getPA().showInterface(3559);[/quote]

That works and it shows up the character interface. Thanks.

Now when I select “Accept” nothing happens and it stays on screen.

There isn’t an action button so I can’t change anything within ClickingButtons.

Anybody finish off the recipe and help?

Read full topic

item.title: Character Appearance on first login?
item.dc:creator: @M0R3TANK1NG M0R3TANK1NG
item.description:
@M0R3TANK1NG wrote:

I didn’t really understand where to put it.

If you could direct me it would be alot easier.

Put code in PlayerAssist.java

public void addStarter() { c.getItems().addItem(1351, 1); c.getItems().addItem(590, 1); c.getItems().addItem(303, 1); c.getItems().addItem(315, 1); c.getItems().addItem(1925, 1); c.getItems().addItem(1931, 1); c.getItems().addItem(2309, 1); c.getItems().addItem(1265, 1); c.getItems().addItem(1205, 1); c.getItems().addItem(1277, 1); c.getItems().addItem(1171, 1); c.getItems().addItem(841, 1); c.getItems().addItem(882, 25); c.getItems().addItem(556, 25); c.getItems().addItem(558, 25); c.getItems().addItem(555, 6); c.getItems().addItem(557, 4); c.getItems().addItem(559, 2); c.getItems().addItem(995, 25); c.getDH().sendDialogues(62, 0); c.showInterface(3559); }

Error given:

src\server\game\players\PlayerAssistant.java:3003: error: cannot find symbol c.showInterface(3559); ^ symbol: method showInterface(int) location: variable c of type Client Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic
